xxl.core.relational.metaData

Class ColumnMetaInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.relational.metaData.ColumnMetaInfo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ColumnMetaData, ExtendedColumnMetaData

    public class ColumnMetaInfo
extends Object
implements ExtendedColumnMetaData
    This class provides relational meta data for a column in a result set. It is an implementation of ColumnMetaData for ready-to-use actions.

    ColumnMetaInfo or ColumnMetaData is used e.g. for defining the schema of a single column for a Tuple.


    By default ColumnMetaInfo requires information about the columns table and column name and also a type when instancing.
    Because ColumnMetaInfo implements ColumnMetaData and is ready-to-use all settings (without table name, column name and type) is set to a default value. You can modify these with getter and setter.

    Default settings
    A column with default settings is
    • read only
    • not auto incrementable
    • not case sensitive
    • not searchable
    • not a currency type
    • not nullable
    • not singed
    • not writable
    • not definitely writable
    • has a column display size of 0
    • has the same column label as column name
    • has an empty schema name
    • has a precision of 0
    • has a scale value of 0
    • has an empty catalog name
    • has a column type name which is the string representation of its RelationalType columnType
    • has an empty column class name
    See Also:
    ColumnMetaData, MeasuredTupleConverter, RelationalType

    • Constructor Detail

      • ColumnMetaInfo

        public ColumnMetaInfo(RelationalType columnType,
                      int stringLength,
                      String columnName)
        Constructs the column meta info and sets a column type which is a relational type, a column name and a table name which contains this column.

        Note: If the column content should not be a String use ColumnMetaInfo(RelationalType, int, String)
        Parameters:
        columnType - A relational (SQL) data type. Please note, that you can use every SQL/JDBC type but e.g. TupleConverter does not support all.
        columnName - A name for this column.
        See Also:
        if you want to use {@link java.sql.Types} instead of RelationalType, MeasuredTupleConverter

      • ColumnMetaInfo

        public ColumnMetaInfo(RelationalType columnType,
                      String columnName)
        Constructs the column meta info and sets a column type which is a relational type, a column name and a table name which contains this column.

        Note: If the column content should be a String use ColumnMetaInfo(RelationalType, int, String)
        Parameters:
        columnType - A relational (SQL) data type. Please note, that you can use every SQL/JDBC type but e.g. TupleConverter does not support all.
        columnName - A name for this column.
        See Also:
        if you want to use {@link java.sql.Types} instead of RelationalType, MeasuredTupleConverter

      • getColumnClassName

        public String getColumnClassName()
                          throws SQLException
        Description copied from interface: ColumnMetaData
        Returns the fully-qualified name of the Java class whose instances are manufactured if the method ResultSet.getObject is called to retrieve a value from the column described by this metadata. ResultSet.getObject may return a subclass of the class returned by this method.
        Specified by:
        getColumnClassName in interface ColumnMetaData
        Returns:
        the fully-qualified name of the class in the Java programming language that would be used by the method ResultSet.getObject to retrieve the value in the specified column. This is the class name used for custom mapping.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if a database access error occurs.
        See Also:
        ColumnMetaData.getColumnClassName()

      • setMaxContainingStringLength

        public void setMaxContainingStringLength(int stringLength)
        Description copied from interface: ExtendedColumnMetaData
        Sets the maximum character length for a string value entry if this column is declared as a string typed one.

        Note: Please ensure that each string content you'll write into this column is shorter or equal to length. Otherwise the import of an entry will fail.
        Specified by:
        setMaxContainingStringLength in interface ExtendedColumnMetaData
        Parameters:
        stringLength - Maximum length
        See Also:
        ExtendedColumnMetaData.setMaxContainingStringLength(int)
